ratings.comment: He did not care about specific students needs and gave homework (busy work) every class period along with tests that were made overly hard. Students with the other teachers enjoyed the class but the consensus for my class-nearly everyone hated him and it.

Ben Post was one of the best Spanish teachers I've had so far. I took Spanish 226 for the retro credits and he made the language enjoyable and engaging. The tests are all right as long as you study for them and the four essays are fairly graded if you put the effort in. Would definitely recommend

He's a good teacher, but like others stated on this website, a tough grader. Not the ideal teacher to have if you are looking to get retro credits and then stop taking spanish, but a great teacher if you want to continue on in spanish as he makes learning the language fun and easy.

His tests are extremely difficult and none of the in class exercises he creates help you in understanding the material. I learned absolutely nothing, got a C and the only real thing I gained was high blood pressure. Don't wast your time or grade, get a different T.A.

ATTENTION: ANYONE LOOKING TO RECEIVE RETROCREDITS.  This is one of the hardest TA's grade-wise. (struggle city) If that worries you, I recommend switching sections.  That being said, I learned SO much from him and he really is a great TA. He is patient, ready to explain things, and is kind with a great sense of humor.  He is very passionate.

He's an incredibly genuine and nice TA.  The material isn't hard by any means however his tests are made to be very difficult. I wouldn't recommend as a class to take when you need a solid A or B to get your retro credits.  I would definitely try to get a different teacher.  I may be losing 5 years of spanish retro credits by taking this class..

I loved Señor Post!  I was concerned when I found out that a TA was going to be teaching my Spanish section, but he was better than any teacher I had in high school.  He always came to class prepared with activities, was funny, and really wanted us to learn.  I figured out which Spanish 204 section he was teaching just so I could have him again!
Very good TA. Clear, helpful, and responsive to emails, made class (slightly) enjoyable.
